snippet: The Fire Department in Narrowsburg, N.Y., canceled its annual display after planned fireworks were said to be too close to eagles’ nests.
abstract: Narrowsburg, NY, Fire Department cancels its annual Fourth of July fireworks display after receiving warning from the United States Fish and Wildlife Service that it could face up to $200,000 in fines if the fireworks cause any harm to any of the bald eagles that live in the area; service says that planned fireworks would be too close to eagles' nesting areas.
lead_paragraph: The Fire Department in Narrowsburg, N.Y., canceled its annual display after planned fireworks were said to be too close to eagles’ nests.

headline.seo: Fireworks Canceled in Narrowsburg, N.Y., to Avoid Harm to Bald Eagles
headline.main: As Symbols Clash, Fireworks Lose Out to a Hamlet’s Bald Eagles
headline.print_headline: As Symbols Clash, Fireworks Lose Out to a Hamlet’s Bald Eagles
